import static java.lang.Integer.parseInt;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class Main {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		BufferedReader in=new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
		StringBuilder out=new StringBuilder();
		StringTokenizer tk=new StringTokenizer(in.readLine());
		int n,m,v,z;
		int []a=new int[1000000];
		int[]b=new int[1000000];
		int[]k=new int[1000000];
		boolean found=false;
		boolean ffound=false;
		n=parseInt(tk.nextToken());
		m=parseInt(tk.nextToken());
		for(int i=0;i<m;i++){
			tk=new StringTokenizer(in.readLine());
			v=parseInt(tk.nextToken());
			found=false;
			for(int j=0;j<v;j++){
				
				k[j]=parseInt(tk.nextToken());
				
				if(k[j]<0){
					b[-k[j]]=1;
				}
				else {
					a[k[j]]=1;
				}
				
			}
			for(int j=0;j<=n;j++){
				if(a[j]==b[j]&&(a[j]==1||b[j]==1)) found=true;
			}
			if(found!=true) ffound=true;
			
		}

		if(ffound) System.out.print("YES");
		else System.out.print("NO");
	}
}
